group_1.narration: Now... I may have said that@“it's the perfect night to see the full moon!”@just a moment ago.
But I'm planning on gracefully@ditching the school Moon-Viewing@tonight in favor of dinner with my family.
But I still have time before then.
So now, I'm hard at work with my humble@after-school pastime, token games!

group_1.textCenter: (At times like this, I'm really grateful for my@inherently faint aura.)
(I don't have to worry about standing out@and starting gossip at school.)
Huh...?
(This magical reaction...!)
(Wait... What's happening!?)
(Why? Am I... At school!?)
Oh... The plates still haven't arrived.
We’ll have to borrow some from the Home@Economics room...
Miss Nanase, can you do something for me?

group_1.textRight: I want you to go to the Home Economics room@and borrow some plates.
We need them for the exchange party with@Saint Liliana Academy today.
You’ll probably have to ask the teacher, but@that’s okay.
...Yeah? Come on, it's time to get ready.
Lilianna’s young ladies will arrive soon.

group_1.narration: Today is an exchange party with Saint Liliana Academy!
We, the Student Council,@were busy preparing for it!

group_1.textLeft: Very well. I shall hereby depart for the Home@Economics room!

group_1.textRight: Hurry along, but don’t run in the hallway!

group_1.narration: Saint Liliana Academy is Kamihama’s@most elite school for young girls.
The school spirit may be different,@but Mizuna Girls Academy was also a traditional,@upper-class school.
As such, the two schools held regular exchange meetings.
Prior to the main event,@the Moon-Viewing celebration,@a tea party will be held with Lilanna’s students@in the Student Council room.

group_1.textCenter: (And now we are preparing for it...)
(We should be... But somehow... My memory@isn't right?)
(Maybe this is something...)
(That I’m involved in!)
(I’m definitely caught in the middle of some@mysterious phenomenon.)

group_1.narration: ―Yukika―@Until a moment ago,@I was gracefully ditching the exchange preparations
―Yukika―@and spent some time loafing arou―@I mean, waiting for dinner time... At the arcade.
Even though I say that I ditched,@it’s not like I snuck out.
Thanks to the Student President kindly saying@”I'd hate to make you help with the preparations@even though you can’t participate,@so give priority to the dinner with your family”
I left school proudly from the main gate.

group_1.textCenter: (But when I think about it...)
(I feel like I never promised dinner with my@family...)
(I don’t have a promise to keep, so I am helping to@prepare for the exchange party without leaving school...)
(That means nothing is wrong...right?)
(...No, no, no.)
(I remember playing a token arcade game a@while ago.)
(I can’t explain the contradiction at all.)
(I still have no idea what’s happening yet.)
(Let’s try to grasp the situation by playing@along a little more...)
(So that means...)
First, let's get the plates from the Home@Economics room...
